00023 #ifndef gcode_h
00024 #define gcode_h
00025 #include <avr/io.h>
00026 #include "nuts_bolts.h" // N_AXIS
00027 
00028 /// -> 842 : transfer "gcode.cpp" -> "gcode.h"
00029 
00030 // Define modal group internal numbers for checking multiple command violations and tracking the
00031 // type of command that is called in the block. A modal group is a group of g-code commands that are
00032 // mutually exclusive, or cannot exist on the same line, because they each toggle a state or execute
00033 // a unique motion. These are defined in the NIST RS274-NGC v3 g-code standard, available online,
00034 // and are similar/identical to other g-code interpreters by manufacturers (Haas,Fanuc,Mazak,etc).
00035 #define MODAL_GROUP_NONE 0
00036 #define MODAL_GROUP_0 1 // [G4,G10,G28,G30,G53,G92,G92.1] Non-modal
00037 #define MODAL_GROUP_1 2 // [G0,G1,G2,G3,G80] Motion
00038 #define MODAL_GROUP_2 3 // [G17,G18,G19] Plane selection
00039 #define MODAL_GROUP_3 4 // [G90,G91] Distance mode
00040 #define MODAL_GROUP_4 5 // [M0,M1,M2,M30] Stopping
00041 #define MODAL_GROUP_5 6 // [G93,G94] Feed rate mode
00042 #define MODAL_GROUP_6 7 // [G20,G21] Units
00043 #define MODAL_GROUP_7 8 // [M3,M4,M5] Spindle turning
00044 #define MODAL_GROUP_12 9 // [G54,G55,G56,G57,G58,G59] Coordinate system selection
00045 
00046 // Define command actions for within execution-type modal groups (motion, stopping, non-modal). Used
00047 // internally by the parser to know which command to execute.
00048 #define MOTION_MODE_SEEK 0 // G0
00049 #define MOTION_MODE_LINEAR 1 // G1
00050 #define MOTION_MODE_CW_ARC 2  // G2
00051 #define MOTION_MODE_CCW_ARC 3  // G3
00052 #define MOTION_MODE_CANCEL 4 // G80
00053 
00054 #define PROGRAM_FLOW_RUNNING 0
00055 #define PROGRAM_FLOW_PAUSED 1 // M0, M1
00056 #define PROGRAM_FLOW_COMPLETED 2 // M2, M30
00057 
00058 #define NON_MODAL_NONE 0
00059 #define NON_MODAL_DWELL 1 // G4
00060 #define NON_MODAL_SET_COORDINATE_DATA 2 // G10
00061 #define NON_MODAL_GO_HOME 3 // G28,G30
00062 #define NON_MODAL_SET_COORDINATE_OFFSET 4 // G92
00063 #define NON_MODAL_RESET_COORDINATE_OFFSET 5 //G92.1
00064 
00065 typedef struct {
00066   uint8_t status_code;             // Parser status for current block
00067   uint8_t motion_mode;             // {G0, G1, G2, G3, G80}
00068   uint8_t inverse_feed_rate_mode;  // {G93, G94}
00069   uint8_t inches_mode;             // 0 = millimeter mode, 1 = inches mode {G20, G21}
00070   uint8_t absolute_mode;           // 0 = relative motion, 1 = absolute motion {G90, G91}
00071   uint8_t program_flow;            // {M0, M1, M2, M30}
00072   int8_t spindle_direction;        // 1 = CW, -1 = CCW, 0 = Stop {M3, M4, M5}
00073   uint8_t coolant_mode;            // 0 = Disable, 1 = Flood Enable {M8, M9}
00074   double feed_rate, seek_rate;     // Millimeters/second
00075 /// -> 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00076   double position[N_AXIS];          // Where the interpreter considers the tool to be at this point in the code
00077   uint8_t tool;
00078   uint16_t spindle_speed;           // RPM/100
00079   uint8_t plane_axis_0,
00080           plane_axis_1,
00081           plane_axis_2;            // The axes of the selected plane
00082 } parser_state_t;
00083 
00084 extern parser_state_t gc;
00085 /// <-
00086 
00087 // Initialize the parser
00088 void gc_init();
00089 
00090 // Execute one block of rs275/ngc/g-code
00091 uint8_t gc_execute_line(char *line);
00092 
00093 // Set g-code parser position. Input in steps.
00094 void gc_set_current_position(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t z, int32_t a);
00095 
00096 // Clear g-code parser position
00097 void gc_clear_position();
00098 
00099 #endif
